intro: Buphthalmum ortegae, commonly known as the Ortega's oxeye, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow flowers surrounded by white ray florets, typical of the genus Buphthalmum. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Its botanical structure supports its role in local ecosystems, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to floral biodiversity.
